definition[0]: to avoid something that is difficult or unpleasant for you, or something that limits what you can do in some way
example[0]: I needed to get away from the pressures of work.
example[1]: She wanted to get away from the traditional ideas of what theatre is about.
example[2]: There is no getting away from this fact  (=you cannot avoid or deny this fact).
definition[1]: to begin to talk about other things rather than the subject you are supposed to be discussing
example[3]: I think weâ€™re getting away from the main issue.
example[4]: You need to get away from it all for a couple of weeks.
